title: DBMS Level 6 â€” SQL Joins
concept: MCQs on inner join and outer joins.

challenges.title: Q1: INNER JOIN Meaning
challenges.description: An INNER JOIN between two tables returns:
challenges.inputDescription: No input. This is an MCQ.
examples:
Options:
a) All rows from both tables
b) Only matching rows from both tables
c) Only non-matching rows from both tables
d) Only rows from left table
challenges.starterCode: // Mark your answer: a / b / c / d

challenges.title: Q2: LEFT OUTER JOIN
challenges.description: A LEFT OUTER JOIN between A and B (A LEFT JOIN B) returns:
challenges.inputDescription: No input. This is an MCQ.
examples:
Options:
a) All rows from A, and matching rows from B
b) All rows from B, and matching rows from A
c) Only matching rows from A and B
d) Only rows that do not match in A
challenges.starterCode: // Mark your answer: a / b / c / d
